section.title: Firebird 3.0.6 Release: Bug Fixes
section.para: The following bug fixes were reported prior to the v.3.0.6 official release:

section.title: Core Engine
section.para: (CORE-6343) Rolled back transaction could produce unexpected results leading to duplicate values in the primary key.
(CORE-6331) Memory leak was possible when executing some statements and expressions.

para.emphasis: fixed by A. dos Santos Fernandes

section.para: (CORE-6323) File-system ID could be duplicated among databases located on different volumes.
(CORE-6314) Assigning RDB$DB_KEY to a multi-byte CHAR/VARCHAR variable/parameter did not enforce the target limit.

para.emphasis: fixed by A. dos Santos Fernandes

section.para: (CORE-6310) Varchar length limit was not enforced when assigning a string with trailing spaces in multi-byte character sets.

para.emphasis: fixed by A. dos Santos Fernandes

section.para: (CORE-6296) Many connections could result in poor performance.
(CORE-6290) Hex number used at the end of statement could read invalid memory and produce wrong values or exceptions.

para.emphasis: fixed by A. dos Santos Fernandes

section.para: (CORE-6280) MERGE statement could lose parameters in the "WHEN [NOT] MATCHED" clause that will never be matched. This could also cause server crashes in some situations.

para.emphasis: fixed by A. dos Santos Fernandes

section.para: (CORE-6266) Deleting records from MON$ATTACHMENTS using the ORDER BY clause didn't close the corresponding attachments.
(CORE-6252) UNIQUE CONSTRAINT violation could be possible.
(CORE-6250) Signature mismatch error could be raised when creating package body on identical packaged procedure header.

para.emphasis: fixed by A. dos Santos Fernandes

section.para: (CORE-6246) Output parameters could be wrongly described if there are too many number of columns in the result set.

para.emphasis: fixed by A. dos Santos Fernandes

section.para: (CORE-6230) It was impossible to connect to a database if security.db reference was removed from databases.conf.
(CORE-6221) Incorrect implementation of allocFunc() for zlib1: memory leak was possible.
(CORE-6110) 64-bit transaction IDs were not stored properly inside the status vector.
(CORE-5862) RDB$CHARACTER_LENGTH in RDB$FIELDS was not being populated when the column was a computed VARCHAR without an explicit type.

para.emphasis: fixed by A. dos Santos Fernandes

section.title: Server Crashes/Hang-ups
section.para: (CORE-6345) Server could crash on overflow of numeric division result.
(CORE-6317) Server could crash executing long GRANT statements.

para.emphasis: fixed by A. dos Santos Fernandes

section.para: (CORE-6254) Server could crash when using SET TRANSACTION and ON TRANSACTION START trigger uses EXECUTE STATEMENT against current transaction.
(CORE-6253) Locked fb_lock file could cause a server crash.
(CORE-6251) Server would crash when built-in function LEFT or RIGHT is missing its 2nd argument.

para.emphasis: fixed by A. dos Santos Fernandes

section.para: (CORE-6231) Server would crash during shutdown of XNET connection to a local database when events have been registered.
(CORE-6224) Server could crash due to double destruction of the rem_port object.

para.emphasis: fixed by D. Kovalenko, A. Peshkov

section.para: (CORE-6217) Dangerous (possibly leading to a crash) work with pointer: delete ptr; ptr=new ;.

para.emphasis: fixed by D. Kovalenko, A. Peshkov

section.para: (CORE-5972) External engine trigger would crash the server if the table has computed fields.

para.emphasis: fixed by A. dos Santos Fernandes

section.title: Builds
section.para: (CORE-6295) Distributed header files were incomplete (missing some type declarations).
(CORE-6189) Building the bundled libtommath could fail.

section.title: API/Remote Interface
section.para: (CORE-6283) Result of isNullable() in message metadata, returned by metadata builder, did not match datatype set by setType() in metadata builder.
(CORE-6227) isc_info_svc_user_dbpath was always returning an alias of the main security database.
(CORE-6212) Authentication plugin on the server could read garbage data from the client instead of the empty packet.

section.title: POSIX Only
section.para: (CORE-6269) Server could ignore KeepAlive settings (server connection/process is not killed when its client endpoint is lost).

section.title: gbak
section.para: (CORE-6329) GBAK with service_mgr and WinSSPI authentication could raise an error in clumplet API.
(CORE-6265) Existing mapping rules were removed by the backup/restore cycle.
(CORE-6264) GBAK with PIPE to stdout: invalid content in the 'service_mgr' mode.
(CORE-6233) Wrong dependencies of stored function on view were created after backup/restore.

para.emphasis: fixed by A. dos Santos Fernandes

section.para: (CORE-6208) CREATE DATABASE permission would disappear from security.db after the backup/restore cycle.
(CORE-6130) Creating backup to STDOUT using the service manager was broken.
(CORE-2251) GBAK doesn't return the error code in some cases.

section.title: gfix
section.para: (CORE-5364) gfix -online normal did not raise an error when there was another SYSDBA-owned session open.

section.title: isql
section.para: (CORE-6260) Warnings were not always displayed in ISQL.
(CORE-6116) Metadata script extracted with ISQL from a database restored from a v2.5 backup was invalid if some table has COMPUTED BY fields.

para.emphasis: fixed by A. dos Santos Fernandes

section.title: nBackup
section.para: (CORE-6319) NBACKUP called via the Services API was locking the database file after error.

section.title: fbsvcmgr
section.para: (CORE-6309) fbsvcmgr could not decode information buffer returned by GFIX list limbo service.

section.title: Firebird 3.0.5 Release: Bug Fixes
section.para: The following bug fixes were reported prior to the v.3.0.5 official release:

section.title: Core Engine
section.para: (CORE-6203) "Error reading data from the connection" could be raised sometimes when using a non-default authentication plugin.
(CORE-6197) The client library could leak memory when resolving the remote host name.

para.emphasis: fixed by A. dos Santos Fernandes

(CORE-6171) Error "No current record for fetch operation" could be raised for queries containing an aggregated sub-select.
(CORE-6163) Generator pages were not encrypted.
(CORE-6150) Bugcheck could be raised when some PK\UK\FK constraint checks a record already marked as damaged.
(CORE-6144) Inconsistent behaviour of the NEW context variable was observed in AFTER UPDATE OR DELETE triggers.
(CORE-6143) Error "Multiple maps found for ..." was raised in not appropriate case.
(CORE-6138) Inconsistent behavior was observed regarding visibility of the master record while inserting the detail record.

(CORE-6134) Different error messages ("Your user name and password are not defined" vs "Missing security context") could be reported for a failed login depending on whether the Win_SSPI plugin is present in the configuration.

(CORE-6090) BLOB fields could be suddenly set to NULLs during UPDATE after a table format change.
(CORE-6089) BLOBs were unnecessarily copied during UPDATE after a table format change.

para.emphasis: fixed by A. dos Santos Fernandes

(CORE-6063) Firebird server could return the 'op_accept' packet instead of the expected 'op_accept_data' one.
(CORE-6050) The client library was attempting to open files not existent on the client host when connecting to a remove v2.5 server.
(CORE-6043) Global temporary tables created with the ON COMMIT DELETE ROWS clause were not releasing their used space in the temporary file(s) at COMMIT RETAINING or ROLLBACK RETAINING.
(CORE-6038) Srp user manager could sporadically create user accounts that cannot pass the authentication.
(CORE-5995) The "creator" user name was empty in user trace sessions.
(CORE-5993) Error message was missing inside firebird.log after failure to create the audit log file.
(CORE-5991) Trace could not work correctly with quoted file names in the trace configurations.
(CORE-5986) Condition NULL IS [NOT] {FALSE | TRUE} was evaluated incorrectly (NULL was returned instead of the expected FALSE/TRUE).

para.emphasis: fixed by A. dos Santos Fernandes

section.para: (CORE-5985) ROLE option was ignored when specified for a remote EXECUTE STATEMENT command.
(CORE-5982) Error "no permission for SELECT access" could be raised when a BLOB is used as input or output parameter of a stored procedure.
(CORE-5966) Slow performance could be noticed when executing SQL scripts as non-SYSDBA user.
(CORE-5965) v3 optimizer could choose a less efficient plan than the v2.5 optimizer.
(CORE-5949) Bugcheck could happen when a read-only database with non-zero linger is converted into a read-write mode.
(CORE-5935) Bugcheck 165 ("cannot find tip page") could happen under load in Classic and SuperClassic.
(CORE-5926) CREATE MAPPING with non-ASCII user name could lead to the "Malformed string" error message.
(CORE-5918) Memory statistics ('used' / 'mapped' counters) was not always accurate.
(CORE-5907) Trace session could not be started if the 'database' section contains a pattern including curvy brackets.
(CORE-5888) Firebird server on Android had problems with NUMERIC values (scale was not reported properly).
(CORE-5823) Error "no permission for SELECT access" was raised when selecting a BLOB field from a stored procedure.
(CORE-5795) ORDER BY clause on compound index could prevent from using other available indices.
(CORE-5784) Lock folder inizialization was not multi-process safe.
(CORE-5639) Mapping created for the Win_SSPI plugin did not cause the Windows user group to be converted to a Firebird role.
(CORE-5395) Error "Invalid data type for negation" was raised for a query containing a negated parameter.

section.para: (CORE-5074) Charset ID of the array element could be lost (zero was always reported) when preparing a query selecting from that array field.
(CORE-5070) Compound index could not be used for filtering in some ORDER/GROUP BY queries.
(CORE-3925) Bugcheck could be raised after attempting to create a self-referencial FK that violates the existing data.

section.para: (CORE-6086) Server could crash while creating some complex stored procedure (containing multiple CTEs).

(CORE-5934) gpre_boot was failing to link using CMake, reporting undefined reference 'dladdr' and 'dlerror'.

section.title: API/Remote Interface
section.para: (CORE-6142) Error "connection lost to database" could be raised when application creates multiple local attachments (using the XNET protocol) simultaneously.

para.emphasis: fixed by B. Walker, P. Reeves

section.title: gbak
section.para: (CORE-6028) User-defined triggers declared for system tables were included into backups, and it is impossible to alter/drop them due to system tables protection in Firebird 3. Starting with V3.0.5, gbak skips such triggers during both backup and restore operations.
(CORE-6000) gbak was reporting the authentication error "Your user name and password are not defined" when the "-fe(tch_password)" command switch is specified and gbak was running as a service.

section.para: (CORE-6104) Incorrect error "invalid request handle" was raised by the gpre-generated code when an embedded user does not have proper permissions for the table.

section.title: isql
section.para: (CORE-6040) Metadata script extracted using isql -x was invalid if some table contains a COMPUTED BY column.

para.emphasis: fixed by A. dos Santos Fernandes

section.title: fbsvcmgr
section.para: (CORE-6141) fbsvcmgr action_repair rpr_list_limbo_trans was not showing the expected list of 'in limbo' transactions.

section.title: fbtracemgr

section.title: Firebird 3.0.4 Release: Bug Fixes
section.para: The following bug fixes were reported prior to the v.3.0.4 official release:

section.title: Core Engine
section.para: (CORE-5905) Fixed some inconsistencies that could occur when using ALTER FUNCTION to replace a legacy UDF with a PSQL function having the same name.

para.emphasis: fixed by A. dos Santos Fernandes

section.para: (CORE-5904) An attempt to create global mapping with a FROM field length greater than the SQL identifier length would fail.
(CORE-5900) Login attempts during engine shutdown would cause unnecessary delays in the shutdown process.
(CORE-5898) ROLE was not passed in EXECUTE STATEMENT ... ON EXTERNAL.
(CORE-5891) The wrong events were released when a dead process was detected, i.e., valid events of a valid connection were released instead of the events of the broken connection.
(CORE-5884) An initial global mapping from the Srp plugin would not work.
(CORE-5881) Network server would ignore any error that occurred in the KeyHolderPlugin when establishing the initial callback with a client.

(CORE-5880) Unhandled: C0000005.ACCESS_VIOLATION could cause the server to crash. The issue was related with events processing and could happen when POST_EVENT ran from an ON DISCONNECT trigger. The same exception could occur if the application failed to cancel events when disconnecting.
(CORE-5879) Error reading/writing data to connection: appears to be related to CORE-5880 (above).

(CORE-5852) The system trigger RDB$TRIGGER9 checks that an object exists. However, existence checks for generators and exceptions were not implemented for checking when granting the USAGE privilege on generator and exception objects. As a result, it was possible to grant USAGE on a non-existent object.
(CORE-5847) The error message returned from a primary key violation was returning "Malformed string" instead of the key value.
(CORE-5846) CREATE VIEW was issuing a faulty error "Implementation of text subtype 512 not located".

para.emphasis: fixed by A. dos Santos Fernandes

section.para: (CORE-5844) Firebird was not cancelling events when the client disconnected. See also CORE-5879 and CORE-5880, above.
(CORE-5843) Failures in a TRANSACTION START trigger were not being handled correctly.
(CORE-5840) A user was able to create a table that had a foreign key reference to another table to which he had no access privilege.
(CORE-5837) Inconsistent results when working with GLOBAL TEMPORARY TABLE ON COMMIT PRESERVE ROWS.
(CORE-5822) The client would get the error SQLSTATE = 28000 ("user/password not defined") if WireCrypt = Disabled was used on the client side.
(CORE-5819) An attachment could persist after it was deleted FROM MON$ATTACHMENTS.
(CORE-5804) Fixed several legacy errors and anomalies in the implementation of the REVOKE operator.
(CORE-5801, link not available) Unauthorized BLOB access vulnerability was fixed.
(CORE-5796) The gstat utility could produce a faulty report concerning the presence of some non-encrypted pages in a database.
(CORE-5793) The error returned from DbCryptPlugin::setKey() ("Missing correct crypt key") was not helpful for diagnostics.

(CORE-5791) The ODS 12.0 for Windows and Linux-x64 builds differs from Linux-x86. The fix results in a minor ODS change, from 12.0 to 12.2, for some but not all platforms. This has certain implications for compatibility, so please read these notes.
(CORE-5790) User with DROP DATABASE privilege could not drop the database.
(CORE-5788) Security Patch: Replacement of use of SHA-1 in the SRP Client Proof with SHA-256. See V. 3.0.4 SRP Security Patch in the Security chapter of these notes.

para.emphasis: fixed by A. Whyman, A. Peshkov

section.para: (CORE-5783) EXECUTE STATEMENT was ignoring the text of the SQL query string after a comment of the double-hyphen form ('--').
The bug was solved by ensuring that the parser properly handled a newline symbol.

However, when EXECUTE STATEMENT gets the SQL query text from a binary BLOB variable, the engine uses a special blob filter (filter_text) to convert the binary blob to text. For some reason, this blob filter treats \n (new-line) as a segment boundary and removes it from the output. In a case where the line-endings in the binary BLOB were stored as \r\n, the SQL query text received by EXECUTE STATEMENT thus loses the newline directive and the PSQL parser is left with no way to detect the end of the single-line comment.

The BLOB filter filter_text will not be changed to cater for the edge case of applying a binary BLOB to EXECUTE STATEMENT. The solution is to avoid using a binary BLOB to store data that is to be used as text.

(CORE-5780) The server would hang when a client tried to send DB encryption keys that were too long to fit in the TCP buffer that FB allocates for sending/receiving messages, TcpRemoteBufferSize. The fix is to drop the attachment as soon as the server detects a fragmented packet in the async receiver.
(CORE-5776) Error "Input parameter mismatch" could be thrown after altering a function to replace an external function with a PSQL function.

(CORE-5773) A PSQL (explicit) cursor could not see an inserted record, because cursor stability based on savepoints and the Undo log could not be applied to explicit cursors. A different approach was taken to implement stability for explicit cursors.
(CORE-5762) Wrong transaction number in system table RDB$PAGES relation could cause infinite recursion in the engine and result in a segfault.
(CORE-5757) Deadlock with events.
(CORE-5755) Granting a privilege on a non-existent object produced no error or warning.

(CORE-5754) Since Firebird does not have explicit privileges for triggers, ALTER TRIGGER would check the privileges for ALTER DATABASE, which was correct for database triggers but wrong for table-level triggers.
(CORE-5753) The parser allowed the use of WITH GRANT OPTION when granting the EXECUTE privilege to functions and packages. This was wrong.
(CORE-5747) A user could grant USAGE privileges to self.
(CORE-5743) A conversion error could be thrown when both GROUP BY/ORDER BY expressions and WHERE expressions contained literals.

para.emphasis: fixed by A. dos Santos Fernandes

section.para: (CORE-5702) Firebird on Windows was leaking handles.
(CORE-4964) Genuine errors during connection to the security database were hidden by the Srp user manager.
(CORE-405) An old pitfall: if an index contained garbage and automatic GC was disabled, it would not be possible to create unique indexes or PRIMARY, UNIQUE or FOREIGN KEY constraints.

section.title: Server Crashes/Hang-ups
section.para: (CORE-5863) A Classic process could crash when the client had disconnected.
(CORE-5830) The encryption interface could crash the Firebird process when working on big database file.
(CORE-5815) The server could hang for 60/120 seconds if the client disconnected during the database encryption key transfer callback.
(CORE-5756) Server could crash when trying to recreate a table that is in use for a DML operation.
(CORE-5436) SuperClassic server would hang under load.

section.title: API/Remote Interface
section.para: (CORE-5911) Connection could hang if there was no activity for 60 seconds.
(CORE-5772) A client connection could hang when working with events under high load.

section.title: Builds
section.para: (CORE-5865) An alignment error would occur on x86_64 when using clang to compile Firebird, due to an optimization in that environment. It was known to affect builds for MacOSX and LibreOffice Base.
(CORE-5824) Segmentation fault during install on Linux.
(CORE-5817) Firebird would not compile with ICU 60 or higher.
(CORE-5778) install.sh would fail if the -path argument contained 'firebird'.
(CORE-5769) Database crypt plug-in sample in Pascal was broken.
(CORE-5765) Missing directives in Firebird.pas.

para.emphasis: fixed by A. Whyman, A. Peshkov

section.para: (CORE-5764) Installation of Firebird 3.0.3 on SLES 12 SP3 would fail with "Could not find acceptable ICU library".

section.title: gbak
section.para: (CORE-5899) Using gbak as a service could cause memory leakage.
(CORE-5893) gbak could crash the database engine when mixing a database alias with the full database path.
(CORE-5833) Metadata triggers for some object types (views, exceptions, roles, indexes, domains) were lost in the backup-restore process.

para.emphasis: fixed by A. dos Santos Fernandes

section.para: (CORE-5760) The server process could crash while restoring a database.
(CORE-5745) SQL privileges error during database restore.

section.title: gfix
section.para: (CORE-5872) Database validation would report false errors "Record XXX has bad transaction" and\or "Record XXX is wrong length" when the record's transaction number exceeded 2^32.
(CORE-5869) Sweep was failing to increment the OIT value past 2^32, when Next Transaction value was already higher than 2^32.

section.title: gsec
section.para: (CORE-5829) The gsec utility was not releasing the user manager plug-in.

section.title: gstat
section.para: (CORE-5831) Output of gstat from an encrypted database was not user-friendly.

section.title: isql
section.para: (CORE-5870) The SHOW DATABASE command in isql was returning zero for statistics with a value exceeding the range of 32-bit integer.
(CORE-5742) An incorrect error message was returned in isql when trying to create a database when logged in with the wrong password.
(CORE-5737) Invalid parameters for gds transaction in isql would cause it to hang when trying to show various system objects while another attachment had uncommitted changes to those objects.

section.title: nBackup
section.para: (CORE-5886) Nbackup would stop working after 32K iterations of backups.

section.title: Firebird 3.0.3 Release: Bug Fixes
section.para: The following bug fixes were reported prior to the v.3.0.3 official release:

section.title: Core Engine
section.para: (CORE-5735) An additional keyholder could open unauthorized connections to an encrypted database, creating a vulnerability.
(CORE-5720) Sweep in Classic mode could run too slowly when there was a big load on the server.
(CORE-5713) A field alias could disappear in a complex query

para.emphasis: fixed by A. dos Santos Fernandes

section.para: (CORE-5695) The function position did not consider the collation for BLOBs.
(CORE-5694) Duplicate values could occur in columns with the UNIQUE constraint.
(CORE-5684) Error no current record for fetch operation was raised while deleting a record from MON$ATTACHMENTS using ORDER BY clause
(CORE-5681) An access violation could occur when an external statement was executed and the local transaction was rolled back.
(CORE-5675) isc_vax_integer() and isc_portable_integer() did not work properly with short negative numbers.
(CORE-5673) Unique constraint would not work in an encrypted database on first command.

para.emphasis: fixed by A. dos Santos Fernandes

section.para: (CORE-5618) Some portions of the pages of second-level blobs were not released when dropping relations.

(CORE-5600) An invalid blob id would be reported when adding a new blob column of type text and updating another field in the same operation.

(CORE-5588) DbInfo interface was not being passed to ancillary instances of a plug-in.

para.emphasis: fixed by A. dos Santos Fernandes

section.para: (CORE-5576) Queries containing a WITH LOCK clause could trigger a bugcheck.
(CORE-5567) Direct system table modifications were not completely prohibited.

para.emphasis: fixed by A. dos Santos Fernandes

section.para: (CORE-5555) Error handling for SELECT WITH LOCK broke compatibility with Firebird 2.5.
(CORE-5553) A database could not be encrypted if the DatabaseAccess was set to None.

section.para: (CORE-5549) Errors could occur when building or running Firebird on hardware that did not have SSE enabled.

para.emphasis: fixed by A. dos Santos Fernandes

section.para: (CORE-5535) The value of RDB$FIELD_SUB_TYPE in RDB$FUNCTION_ARGUMENTS would be garbage after altering the function.

para.emphasis: fixed by A. dos Santos Fernandes

section.para: (CORE-5528) Internal Firebird consistency check (limbo impossible (184), file: vio.cpp line: 2379)
(CORE-5527) External routines were not receiving default values for their output parameters.

para.emphasis: fixed by A. dos Santos Fernandes

section.para: (CORE-5526) External routines could receive parameters with incorrect length or data type.

para.emphasis: fixed by A. dos Santos Fernandes

section.para: (CORE-5517) Classic server could raise the error Global mapping memory overflow periodically and require restarting to accept new connections.
(CORE-5416) Memory leak: Firebird did not release memory after load tests.
(CORE-5415) Found and fixed an elusive bug whereby an unexpected memory overwrite could cause the in-memory image of a random database page to be corrupted.

para.emphasis: fixed by V. Khorsun, with testing assistance from D. Kovalenko

section.para: (CORE-4492) With OR or IN predicates for RDB$DBKEY, the optimizer failed to use an INDEX plan when it should have.
(CORE-2853) Bugcheck: page N, page type 5 lock conversion denied (215).
(CORE-2731) Recursive EXECUTE STATEMENT was not working properly.
(CORE-2502) Cyclic dependency errors in CTE, involving aliases.
(CORE-2284) Records were left in RDB$PAGES after rollback of CREATE TABLE statement.

para.emphasis: fixed by R. Simakov & D. Yemanov

section.title: Server Crashes/Hang-ups
section.para: (CORE-5730) The connection to the server could hang when working with encrypted databases over network protocol other than TCP.
(CORE-5719) Firebird 3 engine could crash when restoring from a backup made by Firebird 2.5.

section.title: Firebird 3.0 Release Candidate 1: Bug Fixes and Minor Improvements
section.para: The following bug fixes and tweaks were reported prior to v.3.0.0 release candidate 1:

(CORE-4911) IMPROVEMENT: Most errors that occur in providers are fatal and it is pointless to try other providers in the hope another will succeed when that one failed. As an example, if the remote redirector detects that the format of the database connection string matches a certain protocol, trying other providers will be futile if connection on that protocol failed. Or, suppose the engine reports some internal database error (other than invalid ODS version) it will be no use trying to open the same database through the loopback provider.

A better option appeared to be to enumerate the codes for those errors after which it would make sense to try other providers—primarily isc_unavailable and isc_no_priv. Given the desirability of retaining the content of the status vector as-is, the solution was to add some more error codes.

section.title: Firebird 3.0 Second Beta Release: Improvements
section.para: The following improvements were implemented prior to the v.3.0.0 Beta 2 release:
(CORE-4791) INSERTING, UPDATING and DELETING were made reserved words to fix ambiguity with Boolean expressions.

para.emphasis: implemented by A. dos Santos Fernandes

section.para: (CORE-4735) An expression 'where bool_field IS true | false' can now use the same index as 'where bool_field = true | false' if such an index exists.

para.emphasis: implemented by A. dos Santos Fernandes

section.para: (CORE-4731) Issuing DML or DDL statements on the RDB$-- system tables is prohibited in Firebird 3.
(CORE-4729) A flag was added to MON$DATABASE to assist in determining what type of security database is used - default, self or other.

para.emphasis: implemented by A. dos Santos Fernandes

section.para: (CORE-4696) Flushing dirty pages to disk after creation of a temporary table index is now avoided.
(CORE-4685) Resolved some risky issues on POSIX when aliases in databases.conf were pointing to symbolic or hard links, allowing invalid database accesses.
(CORE-4671) Internal temporary blobs are released early, to free up some memory\disk space.
(CORE-4610) Diagnostics will now report a tag name when transliteration errors occur in Parameter Block values.
(CORE-4607) Support added for having multiple UserManagers in firebird.conf and for using them from SQL.
(CORE-4605) The configuration parameter CryptPlugin was renamed to WireCryptPlugin.
(CORE-4590) The data type of the result returned by the functions CHAR_LENGTH(), BIT_LENGTH() and OCTET_LENGTH() for BLOBs was changed to BIGINT.

para.emphasis: implemented by A. dos Santos Fernandes

section.para: (CORE-4386) Object in use errors now come with more details.
(CORE-3526) Support was added for WHEN SQLSTATE error handlers in PSQL.
(CORE-3234) Support was added for text BLOBs >= 32K as the first argument for the TRIM() function.

para.emphasis: implemented by A. dos Santos Fernandes

section.para: (CORE-3226) IPv6 support for the remote interface.
(CORE-733) Compression of data over the network.

section.para: The following improvements and bug fixes were reported as fixed prior to the v.3.0.0 release:

section.title: Core Engine
section.para: (CORE-4302) Descending index could be very inefficient for some keys
(CORE-4289) A NOT NULL field from a derived table could become NULL when referred to from outside the derived table
(CORE-4281) TYPE OF arguments of stored functions could cause the server to hang if depending on a domain or column that had been changed

para.emphasis: fixed by A. dos Santos Fernandes

section.para: (CORE-4270) A subquery involving a windowed function and a where <field> IN(select ...) condition could cause an error
(CORE-4265) An unexpected lock conflict error could be raised while connecting to a heavily loaded database
(CORE-4262) Context parsing errors could occur with derived tables and CASE functions
(CORE-4261) JOIN result could be wrong when joined fields had been created via the row_number() function
(CORE-4258) The boundary for the minimum value for BIGINT/DECIMAL(18) was wrong

para.emphasis: fixed by A. dos Santos Fernandes

section.para: (CORE-4251) The Guardian service could write garbage after the end of a message in the Event Log
(CORE-4250) Access violation could occur in Guardian at process shutdown
(CORE-4237) Metadata being reported from system table queries for UDF return arguments was different to that returned in Firebird 2.5

para.emphasis: fixed by A. dos Santos Fernandes

section.para: (CORE-4234) IF (subfunc()) would throw an error when subfunc returned a Boolean

para.emphasis: fixed by A. dos Santos Fernandes

section.para: (CORE-4229) Bidirectional cursor was not being positioned by the first call of FETCH LAST
(CORE-4227) A parser conflict was causing wrong evaluation of BETWEEN and Boolean expressions

para.emphasis: fixed by A. dos Santos Fernandes

section.para: (CORE-4216) Memory leak with TRIGGER ON TRANSACTION COMMIT
(CORE-4211) The embedded engine would hang for 5 seconds when closing, with errors about timeout in shutdown process and invalid mutex being written into firebird.log
(CORE-4201) A computed field would return NULL inside a BEFORE INSERT trigger
(CORE-4198) An incorrect token unknown error would occur when an SQL string ended with a hex number literal

para.emphasis: fixed by A. dos Santos Fernandes

section.para: (CORE-4177) Some Boolean expressions were not being allowed

para.emphasis: fixed by A. dos Santos Fernandes

section.para: (CORE-4159) Incorrect memory statistics were being reported
(CORE-4156) RDB$GET_CONTEXT/RDB$SET_CONTEXT parameters were being described incorrectly as CHAR NOT NULL instead of VARCHAR NULLABLE

para.emphasis: fixed by A. dos Santos Fernandes

section.para: (CORE-3989) Bad performance and slow response were exhibited when many concurrent sorts were executed
(CORE-3921) With bugcheckabort=1 and sweep starting at gap ~21000, Bugcheck 186 (record disappeared) and 100% CPU load would occur
(CORE-2165) Unnecessary index reads could occur when using a strict inequality condition

section.title: Server Crashes
section.para: (CORE-4293) The server could crash on a SELECT with a long or complex list of compound AND/OR'd predicates
(CORE-4271) Recreation of an errant package body could cause the engine to crash

para.emphasis: fixed by A. dos Santos Fernandes

section.para: (CORE-4268) Disconnecting from a database could cause a server crash
(CORE-4267) Sweeping a database could cause a server crash
(CORE-4225) The server could crash when trace activity was attempted on a database having a database-level trigger
(CORE-4185) Server crashes could occur, reporting invalid lock id (NNNNN)

section.title: API/Remote Interface
section.para: (CORE-4283) Resource temporarily unavailable errors could occur while events were being registered simultaneously
(CORE-4236) Database shutdown was being reported as successfully completed before all active connections had actually been interrupted
(CORE-4178) The new API was still returning obscure historical definition artifacts of data fields, instead of proper metadata properties that would make the interface actually usable
(CORE-4162) Warnings were not being returned from calls to attachDatabase()

section.title: Security/User Management
section.para: (CORE-4241) Log-in could succeed with an empty password
(CORE-4200) An uncommitted SELECT from the pseudo table sec$users would block new database connections

section.title: Procedural Language
section.para: (CORE-4247) Positioned DELETE (WHERE CURRENT OF <CURSOR>) could fail for tables with newly added fields

para.emphasis: fixed by A. dos Santos Fernandes

section.para: (CORE-4244) Creating a procedure could be a problem if it involved adding text in DOS864 character set

para.emphasis: fixed by A. dos Santos Fernandes

section.para: (CORE-4184) An error would be raised while executing an empty EXECUTE BLOCK with NOT NULL output parameter

para.emphasis: fixed by A. dos Santos Fernandes

section.para: (CORE-4160) A parameterized exception would mishandle non-ASCII characters passed as the parameter

para.emphasis: fixed by A. dos Santos Fernandes

section.para: (CORE-4145) Preparing an EXECUTE BLOCK that used domains was causing a memory leak

para.emphasis: fixed by A. dos Santos Fernandes

section.title: Data Definition Language
section.para: (CORE-4214) Global temporary tables were able to reference permanent relations, which they should not be able to do
(CORE-4212) Dropping a foreign key on a Global temporary table would cause a server crash
(CORE-4203) Packaged routines with CHAR or VARCHAR parameters could not be created

para.emphasis: fixed by A. dos Santos Fernandes

section.para: (CORE-4180) CREATE COLLATION was not verifying the base collation character set

para.emphasis: fixed by A. dos Santos Fernandes

section.para: (CORE-4173) Setting a generator value twice in a single transaction would set it to zero
(CORE-4155) External routines DDL in packages was wrongly reporting termination with semi-colon as an error

para.emphasis: fixed by A. dos Santos Fernandes

section.title: Data Manipulation Language
section.para: (CORE-4269) Wrong output would be produced when a field with the result of a windowed function was used in a query with a useless WHERE 0=0 and GROUP BY clause
(CORE-4255) Parameterized queries using RDB$DB_KEY would not work
(CORE-4240) Recursive query would return incorrect results if passage through more than one branch was requested
(CORE-4158) LIKE with escape was not working

para.emphasis: fixed by A. dos Santos Fernandes

section.title: gfix
section.para: (CORE-4297) gfix would crash when the size of the description of a limbo transaction was larger than 1 KB

section.title: fbsvcmgr
section.para: (CORE-4298) fbsvcmgr was not recognising sts_record_versions and other sts switches

section.title: isql
section.para: (CORE-4259) Bug in the isql command setlocale(LC_CTYPE, "") on Windows due to a reference to editline, which is not available on that platform
(CORE-4205) ISQL -x was failing to output the START WITH clause of generators/sequences

para.emphasis: fixed by A. dos Santos Fernandes

section.para: (CORE-4149) New permission types were not being displayed by isql
(CORE-362) It was impossible to enter certain characters in isql

section.title: gbak
section.para: (CORE-4202) Backup/restore from an older version to v.3.0 would fail with a BLR error
(CORE-4168) A backup containing procedures or triggers that selected from external tables could not be restored with ExternalFileAccess = None
(CORE-4164) Owner name was missing for generators and exceptions restored from a backup

section.title: nbackup
section.para: (CORE-2648) nBackup's delta file was ignoring the Forced Writes setting of the database

section.title: Database Monitoring (MON$)
section.para: (CORE-4235) Deadlock could occur while accessing the monitoring tables under concurrent load

para.emphasis: fixed by D. Yemanov & V. Khorsun

section.para: (CORE-4176) Monitoring tables were returning incomplete information in Classic and Superclassic configurations

section.title: Trace
section.para: (CORE-4219) Regular expressions with double-slash would fail in trace
(CORE-4163) Configuration file fbtrace.conf contained syntax errors

section.title: Installation Issues
section.para: (CORE-4153) Attempting to use Legacy_Auth directly after install would not work without restarting the service

section.title: Firebird 3.0 First Alpha Release
section.para: The following improvements and bug fixes were reported as fixed prior to the v.3.0.0 release:

section.title: Core Engine
section.para: (CORE-4135) Sweep was blocking the establishment of concurrent attachments in Superserver.
(CORE-4134) A race condition could occur when auto-sweep was started.
(CORE-4074) COMPUTED BY columns and POSITION function could produce garbled results.

para.emphasis: fixed by A. dos Santos Fernandes

section.para: (CORE-4027) Creating a table with computed fields containing SELECT FIRST could produce a corrupted result.

para.emphasis: fixed by A. dos Santos Fernandes

section.para: (CORE-3973) The SQLDA for an aliased column in a grouped query was missing the original table name, column name and owner.

para.emphasis: fixed by A. dos Santos Fernandes

section.para: (CORE-3947) Wrong results were produced when a column in the WHERE clause used the collation option (NUMERIC-SORT=1).

para.emphasis: fixed by A. dos Santos Fernandes

section.para: (CORE-3941) A unique expression index would exhibit a memory alignment problem.

para.emphasis: fixed by A. dos Santos Fernandes

section.para: (CORE-3929) The invalid error attempted update of read-only column would appear when selecting MINVALUE from a list of more than 255 elements.

para.emphasis: fixed by A. dos Santos Fernandes

section.para: (CORE-3894) When an attempt was made to reduce the size of a CHAR or VARCHAR column, the numbers delivered in the error message were incorrect.

para.emphasis: fixed by A. dos Santos Fernandes

section.para: (CORE-3874) A computed column would appear in non-existent rows output from a left join.

para.emphasis: fixed by A. dos Santos Fernandes

section.para: (CORE-3820) Some character sets were duplicated in the system table RDB$TYPES.

para.emphasis: fixed by A. dos Santos Fernandes

section.para: (CORE-3754) SIMILAR TO was not working correctly.

para.emphasis: fixed by A. dos Santos Fernandes

section.para: (CORE-3735) An unprivileged user could delete from the system tables RDB$DATABASE, RDB$COLLATIONS and RDB$CHARACTER_SETS.
(CORE-3694) Internal consistency check would occur in a query with grouping by subquery+stored procedure+aggregate.

para.emphasis: fixed by A. dos Santos Fernandes

section.para: (CORE-3672) It was not possible to use the SUBSTRING function to create a computed index for large columns.

para.emphasis: fixed by A. dos Santos Fernandes

section.para: (CORE-3638) Some collation tweaking: FR_CA_CI_AI collation was introduced; FR_FR was changed to be identical to FR_CA and FR_FR_CI_AI was changed to be identical to the new FR_CA_CI_AI.

para.emphasis: fixed by A. dos Santos Fernandes

section.para: (CORE-3476) The LIST function was concatenating binary blobs as though they were text.

para.emphasis: fixed by A. dos Santos Fernandes

section.para: (CORE-3401) Collation errors could occur with the use of [type of] <domain> and type of <column>.

para.emphasis: fixed by A. dos Santos Fernandes

section.para: (CORE-3373) It was possible to store a string of length 31 characters into a VARCHAR(25) column.

para.emphasis: fixed by A. dos Santos Fernandes

section.para: (CORE-3338) Regression: Code changes had disabled support for expression indexes with COALESCE, CASE and DECODE.

para.emphasis: fixed by A. dos Santos Fernandes

section.para: (CORE-3317) Success of row deletion depended on the order of insertion of the rows.
(CORE-3310) A complex expression involving RDB$GET_CONTEXT and BETWEEN worked in DSQL but failed with a conversion error when selected in a view definition.

para.emphasis: fixed by A. dos Santos Fernandes

section.para: (CORE-3260) Interlock.h was not portable.
(CORE-3250) The Firebird server could not be started under any user name other than root, firebird, interbas or interbase.
(CORE-3239) The collation UTF8 UNICODE_CI could not be used in a compound index.

para.emphasis: fixed by A. dos Santos Fernandes

section.para: (CORE-3204) A constraint violation error involving CAST was not being raised inside views.

para.emphasis: fixed by A. dos Santos Fernandes

section.para: (CORE-3052) Comparisons involving multiple index segments could produce wrong result sets.

para.emphasis: fixed by A. dos Santos Fernandes

section.para: (CORE-2988) The concurrent transaction number was not being reported when a lock timeout occurred.
(CORE-2957) COUNT(*) from a big table could return a negative result.

(CORE-2952) Character class names in SIMILAR TO expressions could be case-sensitive or case-insensitive, depending on the collation of the left part, whereas they should be unequivocally case-insensitive.
(CORE-2932) An ALTER TABLE..ALTER COLUMN..ALTER POSITION operation could result in wrong column positions.

para.emphasis: fixed by A. dos Santos Fernandes

section.para: (CORE-2922) The character set used in a constant was not being registered as a dependency.

para.emphasis: fixed by A. dos Santos Fernandes

section.para: (CORE-2913) COLLATE expressions were being applied incorrectly.

para.emphasis: fixed by A. dos Santos Fernandes

section.para: (CORE-2798) Plan output lacked the names of views when selecting from views that contained procedure calls.
(CORE-2796) DB_KEY was always zero for rows in external tables.
(CORE-2678) A full outer join could not use available indices, resulting in very slow execution sometimes.
(CORE-2508) Use of certain choices of character in double-quoted index names, for example a bracket character, could defeat the parsing logic when generating a human-readable plan.
(CORE-2155) A join of a stored procedure with a view or a table could fail with the error No current record for fetch operation.
(CORE-1712) A buffer overrun error was being caught erroneously in a DOUBLE PRECISION to VARCHAR conversion in a Dialect 1 database.
(CORE-1605) An aggregated query was causing Bugcheck 232 (invalid operation).

para.emphasis: fixed by A. dos Santos Fernandes

section.para: (CORE-1550) An unnecessary index scan was executed when the same index is mapped to both WHERE and ORDER BY clauses.

section.title: API/Remote Interface
section.para: (CORE-3718) The cient library could hang after an unsuccessful attempt to connect to the remote auxiliary (events) port.
(CORE-3475) Parameters inside the CAST function were being wrongly described in the SQLDA as non-nullable.

para.emphasis: fixed by A. dos Santos Fernandes

section.para: (CORE-3269) The client would perform detach incorrectly when the server became unavailable.
(CORE-2484) An erroneous Success message would be returned in the error status vector when failing to connect to a trash database file.
(CORE-2431) String values in error messages were not converted to the connection character set.

para.emphasis: fixed by A. dos Santos Fernandes

section.title: Procedural Language
section.para: (CORE-4018) Use of a system domain in declarations of arguments or return values in a stored procedure could prevent the procedure from being modifiable.

para.emphasis: fixed by A. dos Santos Fernandes

section.para: (CORE-3737) EXECUTE BLOCK parameter definitions were not being respected and could cause wrong behavior with respect to character sets.

para.emphasis: fixed by A. dos Santos Fernandes

section.para: (CORE-3545) Validation of domain CHECK constraints when used in PSQL declarations was inconsistent: it was using the type of the expression, instead of the type of the variable.

para.emphasis: fixed by A. dos Santos Fernandes

section.para: (CORE-3055) The names of variables or arguments could be wrong or absent in error messages when more than 256 variables were used.

para.emphasis: fixed by A. dos Santos Fernandes

section.para: (CORE-3047) Resolution of EXECUTE BLOCK parameter collations was using wrong logic.

para.emphasis: fixed by A. dos Santos Fernandes

section.para: (CORE-2204) Constraints on stored procedure output parameters were checked even when the procedure returned no rows.

para.emphasis: fixed by A. dos Santos Fernandes

section.para: (CORE-1620) Incorrect error message (an absurd column number) was returned if an empty SQL string was prepared for EXECUTE STATEMENT.

section.title: Data Definition Language
section.para: (CORE-3114) Attempting to drop a non-existent generator (sequence) would result in a serious exception.

para.emphasis: fixed by A. dos Santos Fernandes

section.para: (CORE-3056) Problems could occur if further DDL commands were issued in the same transaction following a CREATE COLLATION command.

para.emphasis: fixed by A. dos Santos Fernandes

section.para: (CORE-2696) The ALTER TABLE command allowed the addition of a column with a NOT NULL definition, allowing a non-savvy DBAdmin to wreck the table.

para.emphasis: fixed by A. dos Santos Fernandes

section.para: (CORE-1748) Unrestorable backup: a problem which would occur if ALTER TABLE...ADD COLUMN added a column with a NOT NULL constraint. The fix for CORE-2696 has now made it impossible to do this.

para.emphasis: fixed by A. dos Santos Fernandes

section.para: (CORE-1518) Adding a non-nullable column to a populated table would render the table inconsistent. The fix for CORE-2696 has now made it impossible to do this.

para.emphasis: fixed by A. dos Santos Fernandes

section.para: (CORE-1355) Client tools tended to be confused about how to interpret a NULL that is returned from a non-nullable column. The fix for CORE-2696 has now made it impossible to add a non-nullable column to a populated table.
It is not clear, though, whether this part of the fix makes it mandatory to specify a default value for a non-nullable column.

para.emphasis: fixed by A. dos Santos Fernandes

section.para: (CORE-634) Bad behaviour of DELETE when the WHERE clause was a subquery involving FIRST/SKIP: the operation would zap every row in the table.
(CORE-304) Any user could alter or drop generators and exceptionsߞa metadata security hole.

section.title: Data Manipulation Language & DSQL
section.para: (CORE-4144) When when preparing a query with UNION, the error context already in use (BLR error) was wrongly being thrown.
(CORE-4005) Recursive CTEs were returning a wrong error message.
(CORE-3416) Inserting a word containing the 8-bit character 'ä' into a CHARACTER SET ASCII column would succeed instead of throwing a transliteration error.

para.emphasis: fixed by A. dos Santos Fernandes

section.para: (CORE-3201) The internal function ATAN2 was returning an incorrect value with arguments (0, 0).

para.emphasis: fixed by A. dos Santos Fernandes

section.para: (CORE-3174) An expression index involving TRIM could lead to an incorrect indexed lookup.

para.emphasis: fixed by A. dos Santos Fernandes

section.para: (CORE-2699) A common table expression context could be used with parameters.

para.emphasis: fixed by A. dos Santos Fernandes

section.para: (CORE-2606) A multi-byte CHAR value requested as VARCHAR was returned with padded spaces.

para.emphasis: fixed by A. dos Santos Fernandes

section.para: (CORE-2238) With UTF8 and large varchar fields, IS DISTINCT FROM would cause the error Implementation limit exceeded.
(CORE-1188) STARTING WITH ? (where the parameter value supplied is an empty string) would fail if the plan used a compound index.

para.emphasis: fixed by A. dos Santos Fernandes

section.para: (CORE-92) Infinite insertion cycle: INSERT INTO THIS_TABLE SELECT ... FROM THIS_TABLE would loop forever until resources were exhausted.

section.title: Command-line Utilities
section.para: (CORE-2547) Utilities did not always honour the minimum number of characters required to recognise an option.
Other old bugs that were fixed in utilities:

section.title: FbGuard
section.para: (CORE-2784) Guardian would keep creating more and more threads each time FBServer died.
(CORE-1595) Firebird Guardian's tray icon would disappear after a Windows Explorer crash.

section.title: isql
section.para: (CORE-4137) isql was generating metadata script output with syntax errors in the CHARACTER SET clause, e.g., CHARACTER SETISO8859_1.

para.emphasis: fixed by A. dos Santos Fernandes

section.para: (CORE-3431) isql was padding UTF-8 data incorrectly.

para.emphasis: fixed by A. dos Santos Fernandes

section.para: (CORE-2788) isql would extract the array dimensions after the character set name.

section.title: gbak
section.para: (CORE-3575) gbak did not support backup volumes of size greater than 4GB.
(CORE-2740) gbak would restore invalid views without any warning to the user.
(CORE-2545) Several validations were lacking in gbak.

section.title: nbackup
section.para: (CORE-2543) nbackup could hide the real cause of a failure.

section.title: International Language Support
section.para: (CORE-4136) The Sharp-S character was being treated incorrectly in the UNICODE_CI_AI collation.

para.emphasis: fixed by A. dos Santos Fernandes
